metadata.title: PostCSS: Improper input validation in PostCSS (moderate)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: The CVE program describes this issue as: An issue was discovered in PostCSS before 8.4.31. The vulnerability affects linters using PostCSS to parse external untrusted CSS. An attacker can prepare CSS in such a way that it will contains parts parsed by PostCSS as a CSS comment. After processing by PostCSS, it will be included in the PostCSS output in CSS nodes (rules, properties) despite being included in a comment. 
            
            MITIGATION: There's no known mitigation for this issue. Red Hat recommends to not parse untrusted CSS input using PostCSS.

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
thunderbird is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
